SnowDistribution: Very sparse snow cover, mostly bare ground.  Good visibility.   Winds 30 -40 mph.
Comment: A very mild day in prospect on Monday with strong to gale force South-Easterly winds expected across the summits.
WeatherInfluences: Strong East to South-East winds. Light rain showers during the morning. The freezing level is expected to be well above the summits.
SnowStability: Insufficient snow to warrant an avalanche hazard. See mountain blog for further information.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: Gale force South-Easterly winds. No precipitation. The freezing level was around 950 meters.
ObservedSnowStability: Insufficient snow to warrant an avalanche hazard. See mountain blog for further information.

SnowDistribution: Moist snowpack.  Cloud base was at 1000 metres all day.  Winds 20 -30 mph progress difficult at times with stronger gusts
Comment: Good general snowpack stability but damp mild conditions expected to weaken any remaining cornices above N to E aspects.
WeatherInfluences: Mild throughout with the freezing level at around 1750m, rising to 2000m by the end of the day. A few light rain showers from before dawn to around midday.
SnowStability: The snowpack will moisten but remain generally well stabilised in most locations. Remaining cornices over very steep slopes will weaken and be prone to collapse on to the slopes below; most affected locations will be North to East aspects above 1000m. Some snow loss expected at lower elevations by the end of the day.  The avalanche hazard will be Low
ObservedWeatherInfluences: Cold overnight then progressively milder. Just a few very light drizzly showers during the day. Moderate South East winds.
ObservedSnowStability: Cold overnight temperatures refroze the surface layers of the snowpack especially on North aspects. The snowpack is now slowly thawing below 1000m. Stability remains good throughout. Snowline is at around 800m.  The avalanche hazard is Low

SnowDistribution: Hard snow ice on exposed windward slopes.  Cloudy on the tops with some short-lived breaks.  Winds 20 - 30 mph, easing through the day.
Comment: High pressure begins to build becoming established over the UK through Wednesday, accompanied by a 700 metre freezing level.
WeatherInfluences: A band of rain will pass through overnight and into late morning before clearing to leave a dry day.  Any summit sleet will be short lived as the freezing level remains above summit height.  Winds, generally from the South-East will be strong increasing for a few hours to gale force around midday before easing.
SnowStability: The existing snowpack will continue to slowly thaw and consolidate at all levels.  Snow stability will be generally good in all locations.  Any remaining cornices on North-West through North to East aspects above 1000 metres will be prone to collapse.  Very little snow remaining below 900 meters.  The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: Some light summit snowfall in the morning cleared leaving a dry day.  Strong South-Easterlies slowly eased through the day with the freezing level around 1100 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: Isolated areas of fresh windslab has started to develop on West to North aspects above 1000 metres in steep wind sheltered locations, especially in steep narrow gullies.  Elsewhere the old snowpack is firm with good stability throughout.  Cornices are present on North-West through North to East aspects and remain unstable.  The avalanche hazard is Low.

SnowDistribution: Snowpack generally quite firm, breakable crust in some locations. Summits in cloud all day but good visibility at lower levels.  Winds 20 -30 mph.
Comment: No significant snow expected over the next few days.
WeatherInfluences: It will be mild day with the freezing level well above the summits. Some light rain is likely during the morning. Strong winds will be from the South-East.
SnowStability: The snowpack will soften and continue thawing and consolidating in the mild conditions. Stability will generally be good. However, a few cornices will remain at the top of North to East facing gullies above 1100 metres, and these will be prone to collapse.  The avalanche hazard will be Low
ObservedWeatherInfluences: After a cooler night the freezing level rose to around 1100 metres during the day. It was cloudy but generally dry.
ObservedSnowStability: The snowpack froze overnight, and had an icy crust this morning. It was slowly softening during the day. The greatest deposits remain on North to East aspects above 1000 metres but with a thin cover down to about 800 metres. Stability is generally good throughout. The avalanche hazard is Low.

SnowDistribution: Limited patchy snow in specific places. Occasional views but frequent low banks of cloud pushing through. Winds 20-30 mph progress difficult at times with stronger gusts.
WeatherInfluences: There will be some light rain during the morning, followed by a dry afternoon. Strong Easterly winds will veer South-Easterly. The freezing level will be above all summits for the duration of the period.
SnowStability: All recent deposits will slowly thaw in the milder conditions but will remain generally stable. Greatest amounts of snow will be encountered in wind sheltered locations, such as gully tops and around corrie rims on North to East aspects above 950 metres. The small cornices that are present above some slopes on these aspects may be prone to collapse. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: Light precipitation first thing, eased to give a mostly dry day but with banks of low level cloud rolling in at times. Winds were strong South-Easterly initially, easing as they backed to fresh, then moderate East-South-Easterly. Slightly colder conditions overnight, before the freezing level gradually rose to around 1100 metres by mid-afternoon.
ObservedSnowStability: There has been some snow loss at lower levels with larger areas now being  encountered above 1000 metres. Some deeper accumulations are present in wind sheltered locations such as gully tops and corrie rims on North to East aspects above 950 metres. Small cornices are present above some slopes on these aspects. The snow is generally well bonded.  The avalanche hazard is Low.

SnowDistribution: Shallow snowpack with a thin crust above 950metres.  Cloudy on the tops with some bright spells.  Winds 30 -40 mph.
Comment: Thaw conditions with the milder temperatures on Monday, more settled conditions follow with sunny spells forecast for Wednesday.
WeatherInfluences: Rain at all levels in the morning will clear to give a dry afternoon. The freezing level will be above all summits with very strong Easterly winds.
SnowStability: The shallow snowpack will gradually thaw and diminish in the mild temperatures. Stability will be good in all locations. Any small cornices that remain will be prone to collapse. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: A mainly dry overcast day with fresh South-Easterly winds. The freezing level rose to around 1100 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: The shallow snow cover continues to consolidate. There is a breakable crust above around 950 metres. Stability is good in all locations. The avalanche hazard is Low.
